result.execSummary:
The defendant Karen X Caldwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING December 11, 2015 at 1:15 in Br. 38.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victimwitness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless the victim request contact, and then only after the agent or Court has approved contact.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling or anger management and continued programming.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treawtment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Restitution set at zero.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully comlete recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Karen X Caldwell in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Karen X Caldwell in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  To the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.    State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court.
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.
-Defendant to provide DNA sample and pay costs.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at $0.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Karen X Caldwell in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Karen X Caldwell in court with Attorney Richard Thomey II.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case recalled.  Off the record.
Court appoints Attorney Richard Thomey II, who agreed to accept case.  Court orders Attorney Thomey II to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Defendant will repay the County at the rate of $60.00 per month commencing upon the conclusion of case.   Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38 on 8-14-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld

Defendant Karen X Caldwell in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appeared pro-se.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Upon questioning, Court appoints Attorney Richard Thomey II subject to his accepting the case.  Case passed.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brian C. or his residence or place of employment

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Status Conference in Br.04.vb

Defendant Karen X Caldwell in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 150.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Karen X Caldwell not in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/24/15 @ 1:30pm
